content.raw: Hi Tyler, so these functions work and were originally used by `create_xacro_file`, but do not fit there super well, but kept them around for the compliance testing. ie: compliance may want to utilize a directory where all the allowed xacros are kept \(or kept in child directories of the main\). This is almost the current structure, so I though it might be handy to keep around until we are sure no compliance tests will use them.
content.html: Hi Tyler, so these functions work and were originally used by create_xacro_file, but do not fit there super well, but kept them around for the compliance testing. ie: compliance may want to utilize a directory where all the allowed xacros are kept (or kept in child directories of the main). This is almost the current structure, so I though it might be handy to keep around until we are sure no compliance tests will use them.
